newsitem.title: USA: U.S. cash LPG prices surge on tight stocks.
newsitem.headline: U.S. cash LPG prices surge on tight stocks.

text.p: U.S. spot LPG prices firmed in moderate early afternoon trade on Friday, lifted by increasing concern about the industry's supply position, traders said.
Traders said the supply outlook remains gloomy for the coming peak demand season, with stocks near record lows and already high prices still not drawing in significant imports.
"The consensus is that if something doesnt happen soon we are going to be pretty exposed for the winter," one Houston-based trader said.

Propane prices jumped about one penny a gallon to 42.75 cents a gallon at Mont Belivieu, Texas, they said. Normal Butane offers thee held at about 50.50 cents a gallon, but Isobutane tacked on 0.25 cent, rising to 53 cents a gallon.
They assessed propane at Conway, Kansas, at about 41.25 cents a gallon, up about one quarter-cent from Thursday.
-- Franklin Paul, New York Energy Desk +1 212 859 1620
